--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, James Abley <james.abley@g...> wrote:
> 
> Probably worth cross-posting to the ant-user list. What do you expect
> to see happening? Log4j is logging to the console - ANT captures the
> console output and will display it in-line as part of the normal
> output.
> 

I expect that output sent to System.out directly and output sent to
System.out via log4j act in the same manner.  This seems like a
reasonable expectation to me.  Currently, the log4j messages go to the
actual console and the direct System.out messages are captured by the
<junit> task.

> If the unit tests use System.out (why?), this will be available as
> part of the content sent to the formatters that you specify, since I
> believe that the junit task wraps System.out and System.err to log the
> output.

The System.out usage of the unit tests wasn't exactly intentional. :-)

> 
> I think that a clumsy workaround might be to log the log4j output to a
> file, maybe using an XML appender and then using the ant xslt or style
> task to post-process the junit output and the log4j output.
> 

Interesting idea, but I think it would be difficult to associate the
right output to the right test cases.  (I run <junit> on a whole
bunch of tests at once.)

I can't imagine that I am doing something unusual here, in the sense
of that I have unit tests that use log4j and I invoke them in a batch
via the ant <junit> task.  What are other people doing in this situation?

Thanks,
Ray
